column9: Una de las cosas que mas he estudiado y aun comunicado en Espana cuando queriamos partirnos para aca, y que mas he desado saber con certidumbre desde que entre en el Peru ha sido: ?Que sera necesario que sepan los indios rudos y gente de poca capacidad, para que eon ello se puedan salvar aunque no puedan aprender los articulos y oraciones? I've resolved this doubt: the necessary is that they sepan y crean que hay un Dios solo y que tiene cuidado de los hombres; y who saves the good and punishes the wicked after death. "y de las demas cosas aprenda cada uno lo que pudiere segun su capacidad. He asked Maria this question. She said "no era a los tales necesario creer que Cristo es nuestro Salvador." Later St. Gabriel -- or maybe St. Pablo? -- confirmed it.  455

p. 465 Maria/Angel/saints said: "De los conquistadores y conquistas de las Indias dijo que no tenemos razon los frailes de condenarlas y decir que se van al infierno los conquistadores, y que como han de ser ensenados los indios si no los conquistan. Y que los vecinos no hagan agravios a sus indios, y llevenles sus tasas; que no hay en eso pecado sino cuando claramente son injustas. Y no les hagan otros agravios." 465

column7: recording the conversation between the inquisitors and the fiscal about the second accusation. Fiscal says I accept Cruz's confessions (insofar as they support the case) and we are ready for the presentation of evidence. Cruz asks for all of his confessions to be read back to him so he can make sure they are accurate. He says he didn't want a lawyer but might need help, so OK, he requests Falcon. They give him Guarnido instead.

column6: notary's statement and a bit of oral testimony
column7:
He argues that his case revolves around a "business of the angel". He fears that if he cannot guide the cause correctly, or if false witnesses and "poorly qualified" theologians convince the Inquisitors that this "holy angel" is actually a demon, it will provide ammunition to the Lutherans.

 Conversely, if the angel is proved "good," it will expose the errors of the Lutherans and bring them back to the Roman Church.  Because of these implications for the "Holy Mother Church," he now "begs and supplicates" for the number of lawyers appropriate for such a grave matter.

wants to continue hearing his past confessions read aloud so he can  "record and make memory" of the events to provide a comprehensive response later; he complains about how his case is being handled and how he is defamed, esp by Fray Antonio de Hervias.   attempting to frame himself as a victim of a smear campaign led by a personal rival (Hervías) and facilitated by a lack of security and professional secrecy within the tribunal. He argues that the "mala cualificación" (bad assessment) of the theologians stems from this personal malice rather than objective truth.

column6: Written response to second accusation. 4 notebooks, 112 pages.  On p. 732, he starts responding in writing to each individual capitulo/chapter/allegation.
column7: Viceroy was right to kill the Incas. P 768 The latter half of the documents (under the heading "Agravios del Tribunal...") details Francisco’s complaints regarding how his case was being handled and how he was being defamed by others. P. 779 says he also wants to be presented the 4 notebooks he gave to the notary on June 1 1573. and now he's written a 5th notebook. Together they contain 60 pages. p 780
column9: 768 mentions an Indian a little before they detained me tuvo una revelacion en que vio muichas cosas de los misterios de nuestra fe, y que les decia a los demas indios: Verdad es lo que nos dicen los cristianos. …. Lo he oido decir (despues que estoy preso) que el senor virey ha hecho: Que es disipar a los incas de los Andes y cortar la cabeza a los culpados, y haberlos allanado de manera que no tengan ya los indios de este reino recurso ni esperanza en que los incas los han de senorear otra vez. ... (the fact that they were waiting for the Incas to take back their reino were keeping them from converting.)  Y quitado aquel inconveniente de los incas, me parece que facilmente se convertiran los indios a Dios. Y especialmente si cortasen tambien la cabeza o quemasen a tres o cuatro caciques o sacertodes del demonio y dogmatizadores de los mas culpados en este reino en diversas partes, porque los demas temiesen y no osasen mas dogmatizar a los pobrecillos de la comunidad... 768

770 Now that I've seen and felt the rigor of the Inquisition, I think it's a good thing that it has not been applied to "cosas de los indios". And given that they so easily "se matan" over trifles it's a good thing there's no inquisition.

column9: a los indios quiera Dios hacerles tan grandes mercedes y regalos espirituales -- but at the beginning they have little faith and understanding. Pero los espanoles que estamos en el Peru e Indias no seremos asi regalados, sino que nos ayudemos, pues que Dios nos ha dado fe y entendimiento. Y que particularmente seams ministros y ayudadores de Dios para atraer a los indios de las idolatrias al amor y servicio de Dios. Y de esta manera seremos favorecidos y soccoridos de Dios y de sus angeles, aunque no los veamos visibblemente como creo que los veran los indios.. hasta que vengan a ser fuertes en la fe y no hayan mas menester regalos tan extraordinarios, conforme a aquellos del salmo... Que es como quin van llevando a un nino de dos anos de la mano, hasta que el sepa y pueda andar suelto.  p1045-6  Spaniards will be god's helpers to bring indios to god.
